channel.title: ::starter? Plz coders read this wont take u that long to help me, thanks
channel.description:
does anyone know how to make a command ::starter that u can only use once. (i dont like "skating on java's" tut because people can keep doin it even if they get kicked so they can get 2 sets.)
well can somone post it or give me a link to a tut?
I kinda need this fast thanks :D

item.title: ::starter? Plz coders read this wont take u that long to help me, thanks
item.dc:creator: @lord_ivan lord ivan
item.description:
@lord_ivan wrote:

the has egg thing works i tested it on mine and restarted server about 3 times and couldnt get a new starter so good job with has egg one

but if i have this

[code]else if (command.equalsIgnoreCase(“starter”))
if (hasegg == 0)

{
hasegg = 1;
addItem(995,100000000);
addItem(392,100000);
addItem(6585,1);
addItem(4151,1);

}[/code]

and i want to add message would it be at bottom of hasegg 1 ??? plz help

Read full topic

item.title: ::starter? Plz coders read this wont take u that long to help me, thanks
item.dc:creator: @x_blitz_x x blitz x
item.description:
@x_blitz_x wrote:

Wrong again.

it will NOT save to there char, because its only a interger, and you have not told that interger to save to there char file.

Find the savemoreinfo, and savechar methods.

they will not save that interger, unless you code it to.

[quote=“vrac defiled, post:24, topic:77596”][quote author=x blitz x link=topic=113922.msg2399487#msg2399487 date=1219350532]
Wrong!
[/quote]

It works fine on my server. What is the problem?[/quote]

It works on your server, because your server has

public int starter = 0;

and your server saves ‘starter’ in there char file.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @peepzi peepzi
item.description:
@peepzi wrote:

[quote=“vrac defiled, post:21, topic:77596”][code]
}

    if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("starter")) {	
        if (starter == 0) {
            addItem(995, 15000000);
            addItem(392, 1500);
            sendMessage("Go to the skilling area on the emote tablet if you need more money.");
            starter = 1;
            savemoreinfo();
            savechar();
        } else if (starter == 1) {
            sendMessage("Sorry " + playerName + ", but... ");
            PlayerHandler.messageToAll = (playerName
                    + " tried getting more than one starter package lulz :D ");

        }

[/code]

This is for my server. You can change what it says or what it gives easily :)[/quote]
Im pretty sure that will work

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @vrac_defiled vrac defiled
item.description:
@vrac_defiled wrote:

 }

        if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("starter")) {	
            if (starter == 0) {
                addItem(995, 15000000);
                addItem(392, 1500);
                sendMessage("Go to the skilling area on the emote tablet if you need more money.");
                starter = 1;
                savemoreinfo();
                savechar();
            } else if (starter == 1) {
                sendMessage("Sorry " + playerName + ", but... ");
                PlayerHandler.messageToAll = (playerName
                        + " tried getting more than one starter package lulz :D ");

            }

This is for my server. You can change what it says or what it gives easily

item.title: ::starter? Plz coders read this wont take u that long to help me, thanks
item.dc:creator: @pk3r_john pk3r john
item.description:
@pk3r_john wrote:

this should help.

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("starter")) {
	if (starter == 0) {
	    addItem(995, 50000);
	    starter = 1;
	} else if (starter == 1) {
	    sendMessage("You have already received your starter pack !");

if u get 100 errors, just add a } under the sendmessage part.
Hope i helped.

EDIT:

addItem(995, 50000);

change the numbers to whatever you want, right now it is 50k.

sendMessage("You have already received your starter pack !");

thats the message it sends when you use it twice.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @_Rune_Realm ~Rune Realm
item.description:
@_Rune_Realm wrote:

[quote=“WRX`, post:13, topic:77596”][quote author=x blitz x link=topic=113922.msg2399003#msg2399003 date=1219322757]

Put this along with your other commands:

else if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("starter")) if (hasegg == 0) { hasegg = 1; addItem(ITEM ID, AMMOUNT); }

Yes, i know, and look at what he posted.

A, it does have

public int hasegg = 0;

B, it doesnt write to the char file.
[/quote]

Rofl, NO.

That command changes it to hasegg = 1, that’s for a server which already has it wiritten to a file.[/quote]

Why would it write to the “char file” if you didn’t tell it to? and blitz is right, you haven’t even declared the int to begin with.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @WRX WRX`
item.description:
@WRX wrote:

[quote=“x blitz x, post:10, topic:77596”][quote author=WRX` link=topic=113922.msg2398970#msg2398970 date=1219321062]

well i cant reply on this becuase youve been helped lol

Don’t reply then you idiot.

Also, hasegg shouldn’t reset, because in some servers it is something that is saved into the char file.
[/quote]

Yes but hasegg, in the example he posted.

does NOT get put into the char file, he just says add this with his commands.

doesnt even give the

public int hasegg = 0;

so, it will reset.[/quote]

If he didn’t have:

public int hasegg

and/or

public int hasegg = 0;

Then it wouldn’t work full stop.
